result.execSummary:
The defendant Shirley M. Baldwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Elderly, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Amend 9/13/16 to include attorney fees and restitution amount.

miscConds.notes:
To Be Determined.
**Amend 9/13/16 to include restitution amount.

Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Robin Runge.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall submit to anger management counseling.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
